cultural_property_regulations.general_description: Regulations governing the import and export of cultural property in tourist traffic, with special protections for archaeological items and provisions for musical instruments.

illegal.description: Cultural property imports/exports that are completely prohibited

items.description: Importing stolen cultural property from any source
items.reason: International prohibition on trafficking stolen cultural artifacts

items.description: Importing pillaged cultural property from any source
items.reason: International prohibition on trafficking pillaged cultural artifacts

items.description: Importing archaeological cultural property from bilateral agreement countries without official export permits
items.reason: Bilateral agreements require official export authorization

restricted.description: Cultural property requiring permits, declarations, or special conditions

items.category: General cultural property in tourist traffic
items.description: Cultural property imported or exported by travelers
items.conditions: Must be declared electronically at designated customs offices

items.description: Archaeological cultural property from countries with bilateral agreements
requirements: Official export permit from origin country
items.note: Many states have export bans or authorization requirements

items.description: Cultural property intended for commercial purposes rather than personal use

legal.description: Cultural property allowed with minimal or no restrictions

items.description: Portable musical instruments temporarily imported/exported for personal use
Musical instruments used for concerts or teaching purposes
items.conditions: Professional use for concerts or education

items.description: Musical instruments on loan for temporary use
Cultural property with clear legal provenance and proper documentation

important_notes.declaration_requirement: Electronic declaration required at customs offices responsible for merchandise
important_notes.due_diligence: Buyers must check carefully that cultural property is not stolen or pillaged
important_notes.archaeological_caution: Special care required for archaeological items due to frequent export restrictions
important_notes.bilateral_agreements: Switzerland has bilateral agreements with Egypt, China, Greece, Italy, Colombia, and Cyprus (as of January 2015)
important_notes.musical_instruments_exemption: Portable musical instruments for personal, concert, or teaching use are exempt from declaration in tourist traffic
